questions.question_text: What action helps to see which modules are visible to a user?

discussion.content:

Impersonation is an action that allows you to view what is accessible to the user

Email, SMS, Meeting Invitation is the correct answer. Check the book

Selected Answer: ABE
Initially I selected BCE, as Meeting Invitation makes little sense as a Notification from SN. That is done via the calendar app. 

But in the book, Washington, there are 3 methods listed: Email, SMS, Meeting Invitation

Selected Answer: ABE
as per the book

Selected Answer: BCE
I'm beginning to question the validity of the answers on this site. How in the world is a meeting invitation considered a notification???

Selected Answer: BCE
BCE is the correct answer

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/rome-application-development/page/build/system-update-sets/concept/system-update-sets.html
correct

choices.C: An Update Set is a group of customizations that is moved from Production to Development
choices.A: An Update Set allows administrators to group a series of changes into a named set and then move this set as a unit to other systems
choices.D: By default, the changes included in an Update Set are visible only in the instance to which they are applied
choices.B: By default, an Update Set includes customizations, Business Rules, and homepages

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Textbook definition Retrieve/Preview/Commit.

questions.question_text: What are the steps to apply an update set retrieved from another instance?

choices.B: Verity Update Set is Complete, Retrieve, Preview, Commit
choices.A: Load the Update Set > Import the Update Set > Install
choices.D: Import the Update Set > Verify the Update Set is complete > Link the Update Set > Publish
choices.C: Verify Update Set is Complete, Test Connection, Apply

discussion.content: I agree with connal308876.

comments.content: Yes, but at least in my PDI it still shows up as elevated. The arrow doesn't disappear unless I log out or I start.end impersonation of a user. So the correct answer from this list can only be B.

discussion.content: In Washington, you can select "Elevate Role" again, and deselect the checkbox. Then click the Update button.

Selected Answer: B
By default, you do not have elevated privilege roles upon login. You must manually elevate to the privilege of the role. An elevated privilege role lasts only for the duration of your user session. Session timeout or logout removes the role.

Selected Answer: B
B: Login out and back in

choices.E: Use System Administration > Normal Security module
